study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the clinical effect of Xuebijing combined with hemoperfusion on acute paraquat poisoning, including its impact on alanine aminotransferase (ALT) levels.
results_summary: The study found that Xuebijing combined with hemoperfusion significantly reduced ALT levels in patients with acute paraquat poisoning, indicating improved liver function. The intervention also improved survival rates, kidney function, oxygenation, and inflammatory response.
population_specificity: Patients with acute paraquat poisoning (636 participants across 10 studies).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the frequency and characteristics of gastrointestinal and liver manifestations, including alanine aminotransferase levels, in patients with COVID-19.
results_summary: The study found that increased alanine aminotransferase levels (20.6%) were common hepatic findings in COVID-19 patients, suggesting liver involvement. The prevalence of gastrointestinal and liver symptoms was influenced by preexisting conditions.
population_specificity: 13,251 patients with confirmed COVID-19.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the clinical and laboratory features of Dent disease 1 and Dent disease 2 to aid in differential diagnosis.
results_summary: The study found that Dent disease 2 patients exhibited kidney dysfunction at a younger age and had significantly higher height SDS and Cr-eGFR levels compared to Dent disease 1 patients. These differences may help distinguish between the two diseases without genetic testing.
population_specificity: 85 males with clinically suspected Dent disease (72 with Dent disease 1, 13 with Dent disease 2).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to establish the recommended phase 2 doses (RP2D) and assess the clinical activity of the combination of encorafenib and binimetinib in patients with a specific condition (not specified in the abstract).
results_summary: The combination of encorafenib (450 mg) plus binimetinib (45 mg) showed acceptable tolerability and encouraging activity in patients, though the specific condition and detailed outcomes are not provided in the abstract.
population_specificity: Patients with an unspecified condition (likely related to BRAF mutation, but not detailed in the abstract).
effective_dosage: Encorafenib 450 mg plus binimetinib 45 mg (frequency not specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to systematically review the effect of exercise alone (without dietary intervention) on liver fat in NAFLD and examine correlations between changes in liver fat and metabolic markers, including alanine aminotransferase (ALT).
results_summary: Exercise alone significantly reduced liver fat (-2.4%) and showed strong correlations with improvements in ALT levels (r = 0.91, P < 0.001), indicating its efficacy in improving liver health. The study suggests clinical markers like ALT may serve as useful proxies for tracking liver fat changes.
population_specificity: Adults with nonalcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to analyze preoperative prognostic factors, including alanine transaminase levels, for improving survival in patients with non-occlusive mesenteric ischemia (NOMI).
results_summary: The study identified alanine transaminase as an independent prognostic factor in univariate analysis, but it was not significant in multivariate analysis, which highlighted average blood pressure and base excess as key prognostic factors.
population_specificity: 224 patients (129 male, 95 female) with NOMI, mean age 71.23 years.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety and efficacy of tenofovir alafenamide (TAF) compared to tenofovir disoproxil fumarate (TDF) in chronic HBV patients, focusing on alanine aminotransferase normalization and bone/renal safety.
results_summary: TAF demonstrated non-inferior efficacy to TDF in suppressing HBV DNA, significantly higher normalization of alanine aminotransferase levels, no resistance, and better bone/renal safety over 144 weeks.
population_specificity: HBeAg-negative and HBeAg-positive chronic HBV patients (>70% Asians).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the long-term safety and efficacy of sebelipase alfa (a recombinant human lysosomal acid lipase) in adults with lysosomal acid lipase deficiency.
results_summary: Sebelipase alfa treatment for up to 5 years reduced serum transaminase levels, liver fat content, and improved lipid profiles. Adverse events were mostly mild/moderate, nonserious, and manageable, with no discontinuations due to treatment.
population_specificity: Adults with lysosomal acid lipase deficiency.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the prognostic and predictive value of the ALBI score, which includes alanine aminotransferase, in advanced pancreatic cancer (APC) patients, particularly those with liver metastasis.
results_summary: The study found that ALBI score, which incorporates alanine aminotransferase, was significantly correlated with overall survival in APC patients, especially those with liver metastasis, and could help identify candidates for combination therapy. Patients with ALBI <-2.6 had longer median OS (13.0 months) compared to those with ALBI ≥-2.6 (7.0 months).
population_specificity: Patients with advanced pancreatic cancer (APC), including subgroups with and without liver metastasis.
study_duration: Retrospective study spanning from January 2009 to December 2018.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the ocular, hepatobiliary, and renal toxicities of erlotinib, including alanine aminotransferase (ALT) elevation, in patients with non-small-cell lung cancer (NSCLC).
results_summary: The study found that ALT elevation occurred in 6.40% of patients, with no significant difference between erlotinib and control groups. Other hepatobiliary disorders were less common (1.00%), and renal disorders occurred in 3.10% of patients.
population_specificity: Patients with EGFR mutation-positive non-small-cell lung cancer (NSCLC).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether a low n-6:n-3 PUFA ratio diet could mitigate fatty liver disease in obese youth and whether the PNPLA3 rs738409 genotype influenced the response.
results_summary: The study found that a 12-week low n-6:n-3 PUFA diet significantly reduced hepatic fat fraction (HFF%) by 25.8%, improved insulin sensitivity by 26.3%, and lowered ALT levels by 34.4%, with genotype-specific effects on OXLAMs.
population_specificity: Obese youth aged 9-19 years with nonalcoholic fatty liver disease.
effective_dosage: Not specified (normocaloric diet with n-6:n-3 PUFA ratio of 4:1).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the impact of COVID-19 on liver function, including the role of alanine aminotransferase (ALT) as a marker of liver injury.
results_summary: The study found that liver function tests, including ALT, were altered in 62.4% of COVID-19 patients but improved during follow-up. Only one patient developed acute liver failure, and none with chronic liver disease experienced decompensation.
population_specificity: 100 consecutive COVID-19 patients (median age 70, 79 males) admitted to an internal medicine unit in March 2020.

study_goal: The study aimed to evaluate the safety and feasibility of combining nivolumab with ADT and HDR brachytherapy in Grade Group 5 prostate cancer patients, not specifically focused on Alanine.
results_summary: One patient experienced elevated Alanine aminotransferase and Aspartate aminotransferase as a grade 3 dose-limiting toxicity after the second cycle of nivolumab. The study did not focus on Alanine's effects beyond this adverse event.
population_specificity: Patients aged 18+ with Grade Group 5 prostate cancer.
study_duration: Minimum observation period of 3 months post-nivolumab administration.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the clinical outcomes of combination therapy (UDCA and OCA) versus UDCA monotherapy in patients with PBC, focusing on markers like alanine transaminase.
results_summary: Combination therapy significantly reduced serum alanine transaminase and other liver markers but did not significantly improve primary endpoints like alkaline phosphatase or bilirubin levels. Adverse events were not significantly different between therapies.
population_specificity: Patients with primary biliary cholangitis (PBC).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the therapeutic effects of umbilical cord mesenchymal stem cells (UCMSCs) on HBV-related liver failure and cirrhosis, focusing on variations in efficacy based on treatment duration.
results_summary: UCMSC treatment significantly reduced ALT, AST, and TBIL levels in both liver failure and cirrhosis groups, with prolonged treatment showing greater benefits, particularly in TBIL reduction for liver failure patients.
population_specificity: Patients with HBV-related liver failure (64) and liver cirrhosis (59).
effective_dosage: Not specified (treatment duration-based grouping: >4 weeks vs. <4 weeks).
study_duration: Follow-up for 24 weeks (treatment duration varied by subgroup).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of oxymel and Zataria oxymel (ZO) on obesity, lipid profile, and insulin resistance, including the role of alanine transaminase as a liver enzyme marker.
results_summary: The study found that ZO reduced waist and hip circumferences and improved insulin resistance but had no significant effect on BMI, lipid profile, liver enzymes (including alanine transaminase), or serum creatinine.
population_specificity: Overweight patients
effective_dosage: Group A: 0.75 g ZM in 10 mL oxymel twice daily; Group B: 1.5 g ZM in 10 mL oxymel twice daily; Group C (control): 10 mL oxymel twice daily

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the impact of direct-acting antivirals (DAAs) on HCV-infected kidney transplant recipients, including the effect on liver enzymes like alanine aminotransferase.
results_summary: DAAs led to a significant reduction in alanine aminotransferase levels (50% reduction, P ≤ .001) and high HCV RNA clearance (95.4%). Untreated patients showed no improvement in liver enzymes and higher mortality.
population_specificity: Kidney transplant recipients with chronic HCV infection.
effective_dosage: Not specified for alanine; DAAs included sofosbuvir (88.6%), ledipasvir (50%), and daclatasvir (34.7%).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the antiviral activity, pharmacokinetics, and tolerability of GLS4 (a hepatitis B virus capsid assembly modulator) in patients with chronic HBV infection.
results_summary: The GLS4/ritonavir combination was tolerated and showed antiviral activity, with mean declines in HBV DNA, hepatitis B surface antigen, pregenomic RNA, and hepatitis B core antigen. Alanine aminotransferase flares occurred in some patients, leading to withdrawals.
population_specificity: Patients with chronic hepatitis B virus (HBV) infection.
effective_dosage: 120 mg or 240 mg GLS4 with 100 mg ritonavir (cohorts A and B, respectively).
study_duration: 28 days of treatment, followed by 40 days of follow-up.
interactions: Ritonavir was used in combination with GLS4.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the preconditioning effects of remifentanil and fentanyl on graft protection in orthotopic liver transplant recipients, with a focus on alanine aminotransferase levels.
results_summary: The study found that remifentanil resulted in lower peak alanine aminotransferase levels compared to fentanyl, but overall clinical outcomes were similar between the two groups. No significant differences were observed in metabolic acidosis, renal function, or coagulation parameters.
population_specificity: 100 patients undergoing orthotopic liver transplant from deceased donors.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the long-term biochemical effects and outcomes of oral vancomycin (OV) in patients with primary sclerosing cholangitis (PSC), focusing on liver enzyme levels (GGT, ALP, ALT).
results_summary: OV was associated with improvement in liver chemistry (GGT, ALP, ALT) and was well-tolerated in PSC patients. The study suggests OV may be beneficial, but a randomized placebo-controlled trial is needed for confirmation.
population_specificity: Patients with primary sclerosing cholangitis (PSC), excluding those with biliary strictures requiring stenting or awaiting liver transplant.
effective_dosage: 50 mg/kg/day in 3 divided doses if weight <30kg; 500 mg 3 times/day if weight ≥30kg.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the incidence and characteristics of hepatic adaptation to therapeutic doses of acetaminophen (APAP) in healthy individuals, focusing on serum alanine aminotransferase (ALT) elevations.
results_summary: The study found that 34% of participants receiving APAP showed susceptibility to ALT elevations, with 46% of these cases resolving spontaneously (adaptation). ALT elevations correlated with microRNA-122 and were associated with genetic factors (UGT1A1 polymorphisms) and APAP metabolite disposition.
population_specificity: 242 healthy Japanese individuals.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety, pharmacokinetics, and pharmacodynamics of futibatinib in patients with advanced solid tumors, including assessing dose-limiting toxicities such as increases in alanine transaminase.
results_summary: The study reported dose-limiting toxicities, including grade 3 increases in alanine transaminase in one patient, but did not focus on alanine as a supplement or its effects. The primary outcomes were related to futibatinib's safety and efficacy in tumor treatment.
population_specificity: Patients with advanced solid tumors refractory to standard therapies, including those with FGF/FGFR aberrations.
effective_dosage: Not applicable (study focused on futibatinib, not alanine).

study_goal: The researchers assessed the glucose-lowering efficacy and metabolic effects of empagliflozin compared to dose escalation of existing medications in patients with uncontrolled type 2 diabetes.
results_summary: Empagliflozin significantly reduced HbA1c, fasting plasma glucose, and postprandial glucose levels, along with improvements in blood pressure, body composition, and metabolic profiles, including decreased alanine aminotransferase levels.
population_specificity: Patients with uncontrolled type 2 diabetes (HbA1c >7%) on conventional treatment.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to characterize elevated liver enzyme levels (specifically alanine aminotransferase) in COVID-19 patients and assess associated risk factors and clinical outcomes.
results_summary: The study found that 28.2% of COVID-19 patients had elevated alanine aminotransferase levels on admission, with male, overweight, and smoking patients at higher risk. No differences in disease severity or clinical outcomes were observed between patients with elevated and normal enzyme levels.
population_specificity: Hospitalized COVID-19 patients in Zhejiang Province, China (median age 47.0 years, 40.5% women).
study_duration: Median hospitalization time was 13 days (IQR, 11-16) for discharged patients.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the prevalence and clinical implications of abnormal liver biochemistries, including alanine aminotransferase (ALT), in patients with COVID-19.
results_summary: Elevated ALT was observed in 67.6% of patients with abnormal liver biochemistries, and these patients had higher rates of severe cases, comorbidities, and worse outcomes, including increased mortality. Abnormal AST or TBIL levels were particularly associated with severe complications and death.
population_specificity: Laboratory-confirmed COVID-19 patients from three hospitals in Wuhan, China, who died or were discharged between February 1, 2020, and February 20, 2020.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety profile of elbasvir/grazoprevir (EBR/GZR) in treating chronic hepatitis C virus (HCV) infection, including its effects on alanine aminotransferase levels.
results_summary: The study found that EBR/GZR was generally safe, with common adverse events being headache, fatigue, and nausea. Grade 3/4 alanine aminotransferase elevations were rare (0.7%), and safety was consistent across populations with comorbidities.
population_specificity: Adult participants with HCV infection, including those with chronic kidney disease (CKD) stage 4/5, inherited blood disorders (IBLD), or receiving opioid agonist therapy (OAT).
effective_dosage: EBR/GZR for 12 weeks; EBR/GZR plus ribavirin (RBV) for 16-18 weeks.
study_duration: 12 weeks (EBR/GZR alone) or 16-18 weeks (EBR/GZR plus RBV).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the impact of steady-state GS-548351 (a metabolite of ANS-6637) on the pharmacokinetics of midazolam, an index substrate for CYP3A, to evaluate potential drug-drug interactions.
results_summary: The study found an increase in midazolam AUC when coadministered with ANS-6637, indicating that GS-548351 may inhibit CYP3A activity. The prespecified no-effect range for the geometric mean ratio was not met, suggesting a significant interaction.
population_specificity: 12 healthy volunteers

study_goal: The researchers explored the efficacy and safety of camrelizumab (a PD-1 checkpoint inhibitor) in patients with dMMR/MSI-H advanced or metastatic solid tumors, not specifically Alanine.
results_summary: The study found that camrelizumab showed durable objective response and disease control in pre-treated patients, with common adverse events including increased alanine aminotransferase (41.7%). The abstract does not focus on Alanine's effects.
population_specificity: Patients with dMMR/MSI-H advanced or metastatic solid tumors who had received prior systemic chemotherapy.
effective_dosage: Not applicable (study focused on camrelizumab, not Alanine).
study_duration: Not specified (abstract does not mention duration for Alanine-related outcomes).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of DAAs (sofosbuvir and ribavirin) with adjuvants (black cumin and ascorbate) on liver function markers, including alanine aminotransferase (ALT), in HCV-infected patients.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific results regarding alanine or ALT outcomes.
population_specificity: HCV-infected patients

study_goal: The researchers aimed to describe the characteristics and management of pediatric chronic radiation enteritis, including the role of nutrition therapy, in a case involving elevated alanine aminotransferase levels.
results_summary: The study reported severe hepatic dysfunction (alanine aminotransferase peak: 1433 U/L) in a child with chronic radiation enteritis, but did not specifically evaluate alanine's effects. Nutrition therapy improved the patient's condition, but no direct conclusions about alanine were drawn.
population_specificity: A 3-year-10-month-old Chinese boy with chronic radiation enteritis, severe malnutrition, and hepatic dysfunction following neuroblastoma radiotherapy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy of entecavir (ETV) monotherapy versus ETV plus peg-interferon combination therapy in treatment-naïve hepatitis B virus (HBV) patients, focusing on liver function recovery and seroconversion rates.
results_summary: The study found no significant difference in HBsAg or HBeAg seroconversion rates between the two therapies, but combination therapy showed better improvement in hepatic fibrosis reversal. Both therapies supported liver function recovery and histology improvement.
population_specificity: Treatment-naïve HBV patients (n = 144) from Shanghai Public Health Clinical Center and Zhongshan Hospital, China.
effective_dosage: Not specified for Alanine (study focused on ETV and peg-interferon).
study_duration: 52 weeks (combination therapy added from week 26 to 52), with follow-up for at least 2 years.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects and safety of sitagliptin, a DPP-4 inhibitor, in treating NAFLD, focusing on changes in liver enzymes and fat content.
results_summary: Sitagliptin improved serum GGT levels but showed no significant effect on ALT or AST levels or liver fat content. It was safe and well-tolerated, with only minor gastrointestinal discomfort reported in a few participants.
population_specificity: Adult patients with non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD).

study_goal: The researchers evaluated the efficacy and tolerability of low-dose afatinib maintenance treatment in patients with EGFR-mutated NSCLC, not specifically Alanine.
results_summary: The study found that low-dose afatinib maintenance treatment reduced treatment-related adverse events without compromising therapeutic efficacy, with a 1-year PFS rate of 50% and median PFS of 11.8 months.
population_specificity: Patients with EGFR-mutated non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC), predominantly adenocarcinoma, with exon 19 deletion, L858R, or minor mutations.
effective_dosage: Afatinib 40 mg orally once daily, reduced to 30 mg or 20 mg if adverse events occurred.
study_duration: Not explicitly stated in the abstract.

study_goal: The study aimed to investigate the clinical features of pediatric inpatients with SARS-CoV-2 infection, including laboratory indicators such as alanine aminotransferase levels.
results_summary: High alanine aminotransferase levels were observed in 15% of pediatric inpatients with SARS-CoV-2 infection, indicating potential liver involvement. The study did not focus on alanine supplementation or its effects.
population_specificity: Pediatric inpatients with SARS-CoV-2 infection

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize blood biochemistry characteristics, including alanine transaminase (ALT) levels, in COVID-19 patients through a systemic review and meta-analysis.
results_summary: The meta-analysis found that 16% of COVID-19 patients had elevated ALT levels, indicating potential liver dysfunction, but the study did not focus on alanine supplementation or its effects.
population_specificity: COVID-19 patients (1745 participants across 10 studies).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the relationship between clinical characteristics, outcomes, and severity in COVID-19 patients, including markers like alanine aminotransferase (ALT).
results_summary: The study found that severe COVID-19 cases had significantly higher alanine aminotransferase (ALT) levels compared to non-severe cases, indicating potential liver involvement in severe disease. No direct conclusions about alanine supplementation or its effects were drawn.
population_specificity: 2,445 patients with confirmed COVID-19, categorized into severe (ICU) and non-severe (non-ICU) groups.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the proportion of chronic HBV patients with normal ALT requiring antiviral therapy based on liver biopsy, identify noninvasive methods for decision-making, and assess antiviral efficacy.
results_summary: Half of chronic HBV patients with normal ALT required antiviral therapy. A noninvasive model (AAF) effectively identified candidates, and antiviral efficacy was similar between patients with normal and elevated ALT, except for inflammation improvement and histological response rates.
population_specificity: Chronic HBV infection patients with normal alanine aminotransferase (ALT) levels.

study_goal: The researchers evaluated the effects of different thromboprophylaxis methods on liver function, specifically alanine aminotransferase levels, in women undergoing surgery for gynecological malignancies.
results_summary: The study found that Argatroban had a minimal effect on alanine aminotransferase levels compared to other thromboprophylaxis methods, with all treatments resulting in minimal impairment of renal function.
population_specificity: Chinese women undergoing laparoscopic surgery for gynecological malignancies.

study_goal: The study investigated the safety and tolerability of lifastuzumab vedotin (LIFA) in combination with carboplatin ± bevacizumab for recurrent platinum-sensitive ovarian cancer, not Alanine.
results_summary: The study found LIFA in combination with carboplatin ± bevacizumab had acceptable safety and encouraging activity in patients, with common adverse events including neutropenia and thrombocytopenia. The median progression-free survival was 10.71 months, and 59% of patients had confirmed responses.
population_specificity: Patients with recurrent platinum-sensitive ovarian cancer.
effective_dosage: LIFA doses of 1.2, 1.8, and 2.4 mg/kg every 3 weeks; carboplatin AUC6 every 3 weeks; bevacizumab 15 mg/kg every 3 weeks (optional).

study_goal: The researchers were investigating the efficacy and safety of pembrolizumab in women with recurrent small cell neuroendocrine tumors of the lower genital tract, with incidental mention of serum alanine aminotransferase elevation as an adverse event.
results_summary: One patient experienced a grade 3 asymptomatic elevation of serum alanine aminotransferase, indicating a potential adverse effect, but the study did not focus on alanine's safety or efficacy. Pembrolizumab showed minimal activity in the target population.
population_specificity: Women with recurrent small cell neuroendocrine tumors of the lower genital tract (6 cervical, 1 vulvar carcinoma).
effective_dosage: Not applicable (study focused on pembrolizumab, not alanine).
study_duration: Not applicable (study duration was based on pembrolizumab administration).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the safety and therapeutic effects of allogeneic human dental pulp stem cells (DPSCs) in treating severe pneumonia caused by COVID-19, not specifically Alanine.
results_summary: The abstract does not report any findings related to Alanine, as the study focuses on DPSCs for COVID-19 treatment.
population_specificity: Hospitalized adults aged 18-65 with severe COVID-19 pneumonia.
effective_dosage: Not mentioned (study involves DPSCs, not Alanine).
study_duration: Not mentioned (study focuses on DPSCs, not Alanine).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety and efficacy of combining BRAF plus MEK inhibitors with immune checkpoint therapy in BRAF-mutated melanoma patients, not specifically focused on Alanine.
results_summary: The study found that adding atezolizumab to targeted therapy improved progression-free survival (15.1 vs. 10.6 months) but reported increased alanine aminotransferase levels (33.9% vs. 22.8%) as a common adverse event. Alanine itself was not the primary focus of the study.
population_specificity: Patients with unresectable stage IIIc-IV, BRAF-mutated melanoma.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of routine serum markers, including alanine transaminase levels, in diagnosing liver inflammation and fibrosis in chronic hepatitis B patients.
results_summary: The study found that APRI, GPR, and FIB-4 were more effective than RPR and GP for diagnosing liver inflammation and fibrosis, with APRI showing higher performance for significant inflammation and comparable performance for severe fibrosis.
population_specificity: 370 chronic hepatitis B virus-infected patients with high HBV DNA and normal or mildly elevated alanine transaminase levels (≤2 times ULN).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to characterize the clinical features of a rare genetic mutation (E196A) in the PRNP gene, which replaces glutamic acid with alanine, in a patient with genetic Creutzfeldt-Jakob disease (gCJD).
results_summary: The study identified a rare E196A mutation in the PRNP gene, leading to alanine substitution, in a patient with gCJD. Clinical manifestations resembled sporadic CJD, with positive 14-3-3 protein in cerebrospinal fluid, EEG abnormalities, and MRI findings.
population_specificity: A 42-year-old Chinese man with gCJD and his asymptomatic carrier family members (mother and daughter).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of YinQiSanHuang-antiviral decoction (YQSH) combined with entecavir in reducing the annual incidence of liver fibrosis/cirrhosis in chronic hepatitis B (CHB) patients.
results_summary: The study found that YQSH combined with entecavir was designed to reduce the annual incidence of cirrhosis to 1%, with secondary outcomes including improvements in liver function (alanine aminotransferase, etc.), viral markers, and clinical symptoms.
population_specificity: 802 patients with chronic hepatitis B from five hospitals.
study_duration: 52 weeks of treatment followed by 52±2 weeks of follow-up.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop and validate a simple model to assess cirrhosis risk in chronic hepatitis B (CHB) patients, including the role of alanine aminotransferase levels as a predictor.
results_summary: The study found that baseline alanine aminotransferase levels were significantly associated with increased cirrhosis risk in CHB patients. A 13-point risk score incorporating this and other predictors showed strong predictive value (AUROCs 0.82-0.89 in derivation, 0.77-0.82 in validation cohorts).
population_specificity: Chronic hepatitis B patients (derivation cohort: 3000 from the U.S.; validation cohort: 4552 from Taiwan).
study_duration: Not specified (long-term follow-up implied by 3-, 5-, and 10-year AUROCs)

study_goal: The study aimed to investigate the efficacy and safety of hepatic arterial infusion (HAI) of oxaliplatin plus raltitrexed in patients with intermediate and advanced stage hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC), not specifically focused on Alanine.
results_summary: The study found that HAI of oxaliplatin plus raltitrexed showed promising efficacy (46.2% objective response rate) and acceptable toxicity levels in patients with HCC, with no grade IV adverse events or deaths reported. Elevated alanine aminotransferase levels were observed in one patient (2.6%).
population_specificity: Patients aged 18-70 years with intermediate or advanced stage HCC (BCLC stage B or C).
study_duration: Treatment repeated every 3 weeks until disease progression, unacceptable toxicity, or refusal.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the efficacy of glucagon-like peptide 1 receptor agonists (GLP-1RAs) in improving liver fat fraction, BMI, and adiponectin levels in patients with non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD).
results_summary: The study found that GLP-1RAs significantly improved liver fat fraction, BMI, and adiponectin levels in NAFLD patients, though no significant differences were observed in ALT and AST reduction overall. Subgroup analysis showed exenatide improved ALT and AST, while liraglutide reduced BMI and increased adiponectin.
population_specificity: Patients with non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD).

study_goal: The researchers reviewed the safety profile of rucaparib and provided recommendations for managing adverse events in patients with relapsed ovarian cancer.
results_summary: The study found that common treatment-emergent adverse events (TEAEs) included increased alanine/aspartate aminotransferase, among others, with 61.8% of patients experiencing grade 3 or higher TEAEs and 16.2% discontinuing treatment due to TEAEs.
population_specificity: Women with relapsed ovarian cancer.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effects of 12 weeks of simple resistance exercise on CK18 and FGF21 levels in patients with NAFLD, with a secondary focus on changes in alanine aminotransferase levels.
results_summary: The study found that resistance exercise significantly reduced serum M65 (CK18 fragments) and FGF21 levels in NAFLD patients. Changes in M65 levels were correlated with changes in alanine aminotransferase levels, suggesting a potential link between exercise and liver health markers.
population_specificity: Fifty patients with nonalcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD).
effective_dosage: Two exercises (push-ups and squats) three times a week on nonconsecutive days.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the therapeutic effect of Qi Gui Yi Shen decoction (which includes Alanine) on CKD patients, comparing it to placebo in combination with basic treatment.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific results regarding Alanine's effects, as the study focuses on the broader herbal mixture's impact on renal function, TCM symptoms, and safety markers like ALT.
population_specificity: 100 CKD patients meeting inclusion criteria.
effective_dosage: Not specified for Alanine alone; the herbal decoction was administered 3 times per day.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effect of vitamin D3 on liver function tests, including alanine aminotransferase (ALT), in overweight women with vitamin D deficiency.
results_summary: The study found that vitamin D3 intervention significantly decreased ALT levels (P < 0.001) in the treatment group, suggesting improved liver function. No significant changes were observed in the placebo group.
population_specificity: Overweight women with vitamin D deficiency (n=100).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effects of fenofibrate (a PPARα agonist) on bile acid metabolism, including alanine aminotransferase levels, in patients with PBC and PSC who had an incomplete response to Ursodiol monotherapy.
results_summary: The study found that adding fenofibrate to Ursodiol therapy significantly reduced or normalized serum alanine aminotransferase abnormalities, along with other liver enzymes and pro-inflammatory cytokines. Bile acid metabolites also trended closer to those of healthy controls.
population_specificity: Patients with primary biliary cholangitis (PBC) and primary sclerosing cholangitis (PSC) who had an incomplete response to Ursodiol monotherapy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the safety and efficacy of subcutaneous methotrexate (MTX) versus oral MTX and other DMARDs, including monitoring transaminitis (elevated alanine aminotransferase levels) as a safety endpoint.
results_summary: SC MTX showed higher continuation rates and better tolerability compared to oral MTX, with slightly higher transaminitis rates but fewer adverse events overall. The study concluded SC MTX is safe and effective in routine clinical practice.
population_specificity: Rheumatology clinic patients in a large Northeast England hospital trust.
effective_dosage: Median dose was 20 mg (IQR 15-25 mg) for SC MTX and 15 mg (IQR 10-20 mg) for oral MTX.
study_duration: Data analyzed from January 2014 to January 2018 (4-year period).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess whether pneumoperitoneum preconditioning (PP) could provide a clinical renoprotective effect after laparoscopic partial nephrectomy (LPN), with alanine transaminase as a secondary endpoint.
results_summary: The abstract does not report specific results regarding alanine transaminase or its effects, as the study is prospective and outcomes are yet to be determined.
population_specificity: Patients with renal tumors undergoing elective LPN.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether varying levels of dietary protein intake, including alanine as part of the protein metabolism, influence muscle protein synthesis rates and muscle mass loss during short-term disuse.
results_summary: The study found that 3 days of muscle disuse led to significant declines in muscle mass and daily myofibrillar protein synthesis rates, but varying protein intake levels (high, low, or no protein) did not significantly modulate these effects. Plasma free [2H]-alanine enrichments were comparable across groups, indicating no differential impact of protein intake on alanine metabolism during disuse.
population_specificity: 33 healthy young men (aged 22 ± 1 y; BMI = 23 ± 1 kg/m²)
effective_dosage: High (1.6 g/kg/d), Low (0.5 g/kg/d), No (0.15 g/kg/d) protein intake

study_goal: The researchers were attempting to determine the maximum tolerated dose (MTD) and preliminary efficacy of tucatinib (ONT-380) in combination with trastuzumab for HER2-positive brain metastases, not specifically Alanine.
results_summary: The study found that tucatinib combined with trastuzumab was tolerable, with dose-limiting toxicities including thrombocytopenia and elevated aspartate transaminase/alanine aminotransferase. Intracranial responses were modest, with clinical benefit rates of 35% (cohort A) and 53% (cohort B) at 16 weeks.
population_specificity: Patients with progressive, measurable HER2-positive brain metastases, median of two prior treatments for metastatic breast cancer, 83% with prior brain radiation.
effective_dosage: Cohort A: 300 mg twice daily; Cohort B: 750 mg once daily.
study_duration: Not explicitly stated, but outcomes were measured at 16 weeks.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness and safety of a nutraceutical compound (NC) associated with ezetimibe (EZE) on the lipid profile in statin-intolerant patients with moderate-to-high cardiovascular risk.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific results regarding the effects of the nutraceutical compound or Alanine.
population_specificity: Statin-intolerant hypertensive and hypercholesterolemic subjects with moderate-to-high cardiovascular risk.

study_goal: The study does not focus on Alanine; it evaluates the efficacy and safety of remdesivir in treating severe Covid-19.
results_summary: The study does not report findings specific to Alanine; it mentions elevated alanine aminotransferase levels as an adverse event in 7% of patients receiving remdesivir.
population_specificity: Hospitalized patients with confirmed SARS-CoV-2 infection, oxygen saturation ≤94%, and radiologic evidence of pneumonia.
effective_dosage: Not applicable (study focused on remdesivir, not Alanine).
study_duration: Not applicable (study focused on remdesivir, not Alanine).
interactions: None mentioned (study focused on remdesivir, not Alanine).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the cumulative incidence of phase change and hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) in patients with chronic hepatitis B (CHB) in the immune-tolerant phase, focusing on predictors for phase change.
results_summary: The study found that patients in the immune-tolerant phase of CHB had a mean ALT level of 24.6 IU/L and HBV-DNA level of 8.50 log, but the abstract does not provide specific results regarding Alanine's effects.
population_specificity: 946 patients with CHB in the immune-tolerant phase (429 men and 517 women, mean age 36.7 years).

study_goal: The study aimed to evaluate the therapeutic effects and safety of camrelizumab combined with apatinib in patients with advanced triple-negative breast cancer (TNBC), not specifically focused on Alanine.
results_summary: The study found that the combination therapy showed higher objective response rates (ORR) and disease control rates in the continuous dosing cohort compared to intermittent dosing, with manageable adverse events. Alanine aminotransferase elevation was noted as a common adverse event, but the study did not focus on Alanine's effects.
population_specificity: Patients with advanced triple-negative breast cancer (TNBC) with less than three lines of systemic therapy.
effective_dosage: Not applicable (study did not focus on Alanine dosage).
study_duration: Until disease progression or unacceptable toxicities.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety, maximum tolerated dose, and preliminary efficacy of PG-11047, a polyamine analog, in patients with advanced refractory metastatic solid tumors.
results_summary: The study found that PG-11047 had a manageable toxicity profile with dose-limiting toxicities including gastrointestinal effects and one case of elevated alanine aminotransferase (ALT). Stable disease was observed in 30% of patients, suggesting modest anticancer activity.
population_specificity: Patients with advanced refractory metastatic solid tumors.
effective_dosage: 50 to 750 mg, administered via 60-minute intravenous infusions on days 1, 8, and 15 of a 28-day cycle.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the role of Alanine-Serine-Cysteine Transporter (ASCT2) in glutamine metabolism and its potential as a target for cancer therapy.
results_summary: The study found that ASCT2 is overexpressed in highly proliferative cancer cells and serves as a significant target during carcinogenesis. ASCT2 inhibitors show promise as a strategy for cancer therapy.
population_specificity: Highly proliferative cancer cells (in vitro or preclinical models, not explicitly specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if urinary alanine/citrate ratio could predict future eGFR decline in patients with autosomal dominant polycystic kidney disease (ADPKD).
results_summary: The study found that the urinary alanine/citrate ratio was strongly associated with future annual eGFR decline, showing additional predictive value beyond conventional risk markers. Results were validated in an independent cohort.
population_specificity: 501 patients with ADPKD (discovery cohort: 338; validation cohort: 163).
study_duration: Median follow-up time of 2.5 years (range 1 to 3 years).

study_goal: The study does not evaluate Alanine; it focuses on the safety and efficacy of high-intensity focused ultrasound (HIFU) for colorectal liver metastases.
results_summary: The study does not report any findings related to Alanine.
population_specificity: Patients with colorectal liver metastases (CRLM) contraindicated for resection and radiofrequency ablation.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety, pharmacokinetics/pharmacodynamics, and preliminary efficacy of PF-06840003 (an IDO1 inhibitor) in recurrent malignant glioma patients, including assessing its impact on alanine aminotransferase levels.
results_summary: The study found that PF-06840003 had a dose-limiting toxicity rate of 12.5% at 500 mg BID, with one patient experiencing grade 4 alanine aminotransferase elevation. The maximum tolerated dose was not reached, and urinary recovery of the active enantiomer was low (<1%).
population_specificity: Recurrent malignant glioma patients (N=17).
effective_dosage: 125 mg QD, 250 mg QD, 250 mg BID, 500 mg BID.
